text: Bryan Martyn (27 December 1930 – 9 June 2002) was an Australian rules footballer who played with North Melbourne in the VFL during the 1950s. Martyn won the 1957 Syd Barker Medal for North Melbourne's best and fairest player, an award that his son Mick would later win twice. He died from cancer on 9 June 2002, aged 71.The Age, "The Roos remember Bryan Martyn, a true Shinboner", 11 June 2002, Karen Lyon ==References== ==External links== * Category:1930 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:North Melbourne Football Club players Category:Syd Barker Medal winners Category:Deaths from cancer in Victoria (Australia)
title: Bryan Martyn
